page.title: 03THE TAY RAILWAY BRIDGE
page.content: The present bridge connects{Aberdeen with{Edinburgh and the South;} passengers cross both the Forth Bridge and the{Tay Bridge}on this journey. Built on a curve to counteract the strong currents, this bridge was opened on{July 11th 1887}because in{ {1879},a train carrying{75}passengers plunged into the river as the first Tay Rail Bridge collapsed at the height of a great storm. All were killed; only{46}bodies were recovered. This first bridge, at the time{the {longest bridge in the world,}collapsed because of cheap engineering after only 19 months of operation. It is possible the slang word{ {"Botch"}comes from the name of the architect,{Thomas Bouch.} The new bridge was designed by{W.H. {Barlow,}with ironwork by{Sir William {Arrol;}it was completed in{1886.}
